gameDescription: Two advanced airships, working with Greater Good Charities and Wildlife At Risk, embark on a daring mission to rescue pangolins from illegal poaching sites in Africa and transport them to a newly-built enclosure in Vietnam. Each decision made by the airship crews affects the success of the mission and the well-being of the endangered pangolins.

blueTeam.name: Orion Protectors
blueTeam.description: Skilled in stealthy and calm navigation, ensuring minimal stress to the pangolins during transport.

redTeam.name: Pegasus Guardians
redTeam.description: Experts in onboard animal care and medical interventions during transport.

turns.scenario: Both airships identify a poached pangolin group but itâ€™s a heavily guarded site. They must decide what approach to take.

options.A: Launch a quick-lighting smoke bomb to confuse the poachers and quickly swoop in for rescue.
options.B: Coordinate with local law enforcement for a joint rescue plan.

AA.narrative: Both teams swiftly confuse and stun the poachers, successfully rescuing the pangolins but drawing attention from nearby poachers, making future operations riskier.

AB.narrative: One team distracts the poachers whilst the other aids law enforcement. The smoke distracts the poachers long enough for the pangolins to be safely retrieved.

BA.narrative: One team aids law enforcement whilst the other distracts the poachers. The joint rescue plan works smoothly, allowing for a safer approach in future missions.

BB.narrative: Both teams coordinate with local law enforcement, ensuring a well-planned and stealthy rescue, although it takes more time. This develops a good rapport with local authorities for future missions.

turns.scenario: During transportation, some pangolins show signs of health complications due to stress.

options.A: Reduce airship speed, increasing travel time but minimizing the stress-causing turbulence, and continue onboard medical treatment.
options.B: Keep current speed and intensify onboard medical treatment.

AA.narrative: Both teams decide to reduce speed and focus on treatment. It causes delay, however the pangolins recover, ensuring safe arrival at the sanctuary.

AB.narrative: One team slows down whilst the other maintains speed. Slow and steady wins the race as their pangolins show better recovery due to less turbulence.

BA.narrative: One team keeps speed, while the other slows down, combining efforts allow for well-managed stress. The fast airship's roast has better equipment for handling medical emergencies.

BB.narrative: Both teams keep speed and increase medical treatment. A risky choice, but their expertise keeps most pangolins in stable conditions.

turns.scenario: Approaching Vietnam, teams face strict air traffic regulations, and a disruption caused by a typhoon warning.

options.A: Divert the route to evade the typhoon, causing delay but ensuring safety.
options.B: Keep current route, maintain communication with air traffic control, and rely on advanced anti-typhoon technology.

AA.narrative: Both teams divert the route, causing delay but ensuring the pangolins arrive safely. They showed understanding of natural forces and commitment to their mission.

AB.narrative: One team diverts, while the other continues and relies on their anti-typhoon mechanisms. The divers had a smoother journey, while the others faced some difficulties but managed to handle it.

BA.narrative: One team continues while the other diverts. The continued troop face minor difficulties but the advanced technology pay off, giving them lead.

BB.narrative: Both teams brave the weather and continue on their path. Their state of the art airships were able to endure the weather, showing their resilience and dedication.
